description.p: When you select this boon, you may spend a short rest creating an eldritch bond with a cloak that you are touching for the entire time. When completed, the cloak automatically attaches to your body, and cannot be removed from your body by any creatures other than you. While this bond exists, you may use a bonus action to teleport up to 30 ft. in any direction. You may use that feature a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum 1), and all expended uses are restored after completing a short or long rest.

sheet.description: You may use a bonus action to teleport up to 30 ft. in any direction when you have bonded with a cloak (done during a short rest).

description.p: After selecting this pact boon, you gain access to a small, vaguely humanoid doll. As part of a short or long rest, you may spend an hour meditating to materialize a new one. You can only have one doll at once. While it is on your person, you may use a bonus action to designate a creature that you can see within 30 ft. of you. You gain the following benefits against that creature until the effect wears off:

ul.li: Upon a hit, your spell and weapon attacks deal an extra 1d8 psychic or necrotic damage to it (your choice).
It has disadvantage on saving throws against your spells.
It has disadvantage on attack rolls against you or your companions.

description.p: The hex lasts for 1 day or until you dispel it as a bonus action. You may use this feature a number of times equal to your Charisma Modifier (minimum 1), and all expended uses are restored after completing a long rest.

sheet.description: While you have your pact doll on your person, you may designate a creature that you can see within 30 ft. of you. You gain the following benefits against that creature for 1 day or until dispelled (bonus action): your spell and weapon attacks deal extra 1d8 psychic or necrotic damage; creature has disadvantage on saving throws against your spells; and creature has disadvantage on attack rolls against you or your companions.

description.p: When you select this boon, one of your eyes is replaced by a new, otherworldly eye of your choice. You can choose the appearance of the eye, and can change its appearance during a short or long rest. While you have the eye, you cannot be blinded in that eye, and you have proficiency in two of the following skills of your choice: Arcana, Insight, Investigation, and Perception. Additionally, you can choose one of the proficiencies, and gain expertise in that skill.

sheet.description: While you have the eye, you cannot be blinded in that eye.

select.name: Skill Proficiency, Pact of the Eye

description.p: When you select this boon, you gain a special tattoo or mark from your patron. It can be made in their visage, or be a symbol that represents them. As a bonus action, you may use the mark to regain a warlock spell slot. You must take a long rest before being able to do so again.

sheet.description: You may use the mark to regain a warlock spell slot.

description.p: When you pick this pact boon, you gain a mask from your patron. The mask cannot be destroyed, and while it is on the same plane as you, you may use your bonus action to call it to you, instantly teleporting it onto your face. If you lose it, you can perform a ritual over the course of a short rest to get a new one. You can perform an hour-long ritual to give another magical mask the properties of your Pact Mask, in addition to the mask’s original properties. While you are wearing the mask, and a humanoid within 60 ft. of you that you can see is killed, you may use your reaction to steal its visage. While you have this creatures visage, you may use a bonus action to become that creature. While this is active, you are physically identical to it, your clothes become identical to the ones it was wearing when it died, you can perfectly mimic its voice, and you know everything about it except for its darkest secrets. The visage is non-illusionary, and you are actually physically changed by it. This effect lasts for 1 hour, or until you dispel it as a bonus action. After you have expended a visage, it is gone forever, and you cannot use this feature until you finish a long rest.

sheet.description: While you are wearing the mask, and a humanoid within 60 ft. of you that you can see is killed, you may use your reaction to steal its visage. While you have this creatures visage, you may use a bonus action to become that creature. While this is active, you are physically identical to it, your clothes become identical to the ones it was wearing when it died, you can perfectly mimic its voice, and you know everything about it except for its darkest secrets. The visage is non-illusionary, and you are actually physically changed by it. This effect lasts for 1 hour, or until you dispel it as a bonus action. After you have expended a visage, it is gone forever.

description.p: When you select this boon, you gain a magical ring from your patron. The ring cannot be destroyed, and while it is on the same plane as you, you may use your bonus action to call it to you, instantly teleporting it onto your finger. If you lose it, you can perform a ritual over the course of a short rest to get a new one. You can perform an hour-long ritual to give another magical ring the properties of your Pact Ring, in addition to the ring’s original properties. While you have the ring on, you have a pool of points equal to 3 times your warlock level. As an action, you can touch a creature within 5 ft. of you and expend a number of points of your choice. That creature regains hit points equal to the amount of points spent. All of the ring’s points are restored upon the completion of a long rest.

sheet.description: While you have the ring on, you can touch a creature within 5 ft. of you and expend a number of points of your choice. That creature regains hit points equal to the amount of points spent.

description.p: When you select this boon, you gain a magical set of tools from your patron. The tools cannot be destroyed, and while they are on the same plane as you, you may use your bonus action to call them to you, instantly teleporting it into your hands. If you lose them, you can perform a ritual over the course of a short rest to get a new set. You can perform an hour-long ritual to give another magical set of tools the properties of your Pact Tools, in addition to the tools’ original properties. As part of a long rest, you can choose to change the form of your tools. While these tools are in your possession, you are proficient in them, you can use them as a spellcasting focus, and you can add your Charisma modifier to checks made with them.

sheet.description: While these tools are in your possession, you are proficient in them, you can use them as a spellcasting focus, and you can add your Charisma modifier to checks made with them.

While you are wearing your Pact Cloak, your AC equals 12 + your Charisma modifier (minimum of +1). Additionally, when you fail a Strength, Dexterity, or Constitution saving throw while you are wearing your Pact Cloak, you may instead choose to succeed. You must complete a long rest before you use this feature again.

sheet.description: When you fail a Strength, Dexterity, or Constitution saving throw while you are wearing your Pact Cloak, you may instead choose to succeed.

sheet.description: When you cast the mending cantrip, you can use it to restore the properties of magical items, and if you target a construct with it, the construct regains 1d6 hit points.

description.p: Prerequisites: Pact of the Mask, 5th level

You can use your Pact Mask to steal the forms of beasts. When you are wearing your mask, and a beast within 60 ft. of you dies, you may use your reaction to steal its form. You adopt all of its characteristics, including STR, DEX, and CON scores, size, creature type, movement, special senses, actions, and special features. Your hit points and WIS, INT, and CHA scores do not change. Any gear you are wearing melts into your new body or falls to the ground. This effect lasts for an hour or until you dispel it as a bonus action, and doing this means that you cannot use it or the Pact of the Mask again until you finish a long rest.

sheet.description: When you are wearing your mask, and a beast within 60 ft. of you dies, you may use your reaction to steal its form for up to 1 hour. You adopt all of its characteristics, including STR, DEX, and CON scores, size, creature type, movement, special senses, actions, and special features.

sheet.description: When you hit a creature with an attack, you can cause that creature’s magical capabilities to be temporarily drained. That creature cannot cast spells, use magic items, or activate magical effects until the end of your next turn.

Your bond with your familiar grows stronger. While you are within 15 ft. of the familiar created by your Pact Boon, you and your familiar gain one of the following benefits:

ul.li: You both have a +1 to your AC.
You both have 30 ft. of darkvision, which is added onto any other darkvision you had from other sources.
You both have advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened.
You both have a +1 to all attack and damage rolls you make.
You both have advantage on Perception and Stealth checks.

description.p: When you complete a long rest, you can change the effect caused by this feature to a new effect.

You can change the effect after a long rest.

description.p: Prerequisites: Pact of the Tome, 15th level

Your Book of Shadows gains a new page overnight. While your Pact Tome is on your person, you can spend 1 minute writing the true name of a creature 10 times. This can only be the name of a specific individual rather than the name of a creature type, and the individual’s CR cannot be higher than your warlock level. After this ritual is complete, the creature must make a Constitution saving throw against your spell save DC. Upon a failure, the target is instantly killed, unable to be revived short of a wish spell. Upon a success, a creature takes 6d10 necrotic damage. You know whether the creature succeeded or failed after completing the ritual. Regardless of whether or not the creature fails, it is immune to this effect forever afterward. You must wait 7 days before using this feature again. If you run out of space on the new page, the Tome continuously regains new pages to use this feature with.

If this reduces the damage to 0, you can redirect the spell towards a creature within range using your spellcasting modifier or spell save DC as necessary. You may do this a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1) before having to take a long rest.

As an action, you can force a creature that you can see within 30 ft. of you to make a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC. Upon a failure, that creature cannot speak coherently for the next minute, and upon a success, the creature is unaffected. While affected in this way, the target cannot provide verbal components for spells, and cannot be understood in any magical or nonmagical way. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1) before having to take a long rest.

If your Pact Weapon has the thrown property, it returns to your hand after being thrown.
Ranged attack rolls with your Pact Weapon ignore quarter and half cover, and attacking at long range doesn’t impose disadvantage.
